alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:43AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Okmulgee and southeastern Okfuskee Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 242 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Clearview, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Henryetta... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Clearview... Pharoah... Bryant... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 225 and 243. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
